title: DESCRIPTION file updates
body:
"Authors@R" and "BugReports" fields added to DESCRIPTION file.  My further suggestions:

1. "Authors@R" field is added for proper inclusion of all authors and contributors.
This field is a better alternative to  "Author" and "Maintainer" fields. Thus these two can be removed.
2. I think that other contributors should also be listed in "Authors@R" by adding role "ctb".
3. Is URL in DESCRIPTION up to date as `hyperSpec` is now on `GitHub`?

title: Update building instructions
body:
I updated building instructions according my experience. I also added typical error messages because:
a) it makes one sure that he\she defined problem correctly;
b) it may help other people out there who googled an error message.
Some helpful information for Windows users also added.

title: Fix makefile issues
body:
* **Remove pipelines (|).** Pipelines in makefiles cause an error: `*** No rule to make target '|', needed by 'fileio.pdf'.  Stop.`.
* **Fix cp for rawdata.** `pkg-doc` target pkg-doc has wrong cp commands for rawdata of laser and flu. (`cp: 'rawdata' and './rawdata' are the same file`)
* **Use ward.D** to avoid warning messages. `The "ward" method has been renamed to "ward.D"; note new "ward.D2"`
* Fix superclean target. -d and -x options are needed for `git clean` to clean files and directories untracked by git.

title: Issue new 6
body:
Finally, I've run tests.
NOTE:
* Changed output of guesswavelength.R if it could not guess. That's becasue seq_len fails when there is no colnames (`colnames` returns NULL).
* Made as.hyperSpec applieble for data.frames. I think that's fair enough, since data.frames available for `new(...)`.

title: Issue makefile 31
body:
This merge closes issue #31 

### A brief changlog:
 * I did several small changes to Makefiles (mainly removal of `--clean` option)
 * I have written building instructions
 * I fixed issues with vignettes "baseline" and "plotting" - it was not possible to build them with the newer version of hyperSpec
 * I fixed a small issue in `spc.fit.poly.below`
